title: Dual Grid-Forming Converter
abstract:
This letter proposes a dual model for grid-forming (GFM) controlled
converters. The model is inspired from the observation that the structures of
the active and reactive power equations of lossy synchronous machine models are
almost symmetrical in terms of armature resistance and transient reactance. The
proposed device is able to compensate grid power unbalance without requiring a
frequency signal. In fact, the active power control is based on the rate of
change of the voltage magnitude. On the other hand, synchronization and
frequency control is obtained through the reactive power support. The letter
shows that the proposed dual-GFM control is robust and capable of recovering a
normal operating condition following large contingencies, such as load outages
and three-phase faults.
subjects: Electrical Engineering and Systems Science/Systems and Control
